title: Barium-doped iron nanoparticles supported on MgO as an efficient catalyst for ammonia synthesis under mild reaction conditions
content:
Sustainable Energy Fuels, 2024, 8,2593-2600
DOI: 10.1039/D4SE00411F, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Kohei Era, Katsutoshi Sato, Shin-ichiro Miyahara, Takahiro Naito, Kanishka De Silva, Saeid Akrami, Hiroshi Yamada, Takaaki Toriyama, Takehiro Tamaoka, Tomokazu Yamamoto, Yasukazu Murakami, Koji Inazu, Katsutoshi Nagaoka
A Ba-doped Fe/MgO catalyst pre-reduced at 700 °C, much higher than that of conventional Fe catalysts, forms an Fe0-core and BaO-shell structure. This enhances ammonia synthesis activity due to electron donation from BaO to N2via Fe0.
